petalsList.petalContent:
He Loves me.

More than I can comprehend. Like a blue rose in the dead of winter, unknown of the warmth and comfort he provides each night. Giving life to my roots and tending to my soil, a soft light, growing me to new heights.

He loves me not.

Because of my sharp thorns underneath, guarding from the past, present, and future, intimidating onlookers with my teeth. Making snide comments and quick to critique, hurting him and whomever is within reach.

He Loves me.

Unconditional and constant, like time marching forward.
These peddles, however, will never wilt from neglect or fade from the day. They will lie still in patience, content with the recent chapter, awaiting for a new page.

He Loves me not.

For it comes at much too high of a cost. My words can be icy, cold hearted, and sometimes double crossed. My passion still fiery, but burns, stings, and exhausts. Lacking a theme, wit, or cleverness, unlike our snowy friend, dear Robert Frost.

He Loves me.

Because how could you not. Our love is intoxicating, not poison or rot. It is our love that is not bounded by the tangible realm of our lives, but rather the exciting ambiguity of what's next that keeps us alive.

So my love, I say, to a very select few,

What scripture, Shakespeare, and even Hebrews try to do,
That may the earth, moon, and stars align.
So that I may write down, with the correct words, one last line.
A confession of affection, and a vulnerable state of mind...

That I love you not,
for the reasons you already knew,

But rather for the beautiful, organic, and original pieces, that can only be described as a rosy blue hue.
